intro: Ecbolium moricandianum, commonly known as the Moricandia thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
